timeline.message: Finish and return from fragment if state not available

timeline.bodyText: Should we do this in the base class?
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: It is already done there but is not sufficient as that method returns back here
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: super is called first, which does this logic and returns. Then we are back here, try to use the state param, it is NULL and we get NPE
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText:
ahh okay.
In the base class, can we move the logic to onCreate instead? (before extractState is called).
Thanks for catching the bug btw.
replies.author: rpdome
shahzaibj

replies.bodyText:
We could make extractState() takes NonNull parameter only, and then put the check inside onCreate(). We're already doing half the check there (if savedInstanceState==null) anyway.
I just prefer having the check in one place - it's easier to maintain.
replies.author: rpdome
